The first test is an hour, but you don't have to stay there. You drink some liquid then you can't do any exercise for an hour then come back. Very simple, you can probably refuse but it is not recommended because if you do have gestational diabetes you need to be able to keep track so you and baby are healthy.

My friend refused it at my old OB, and they stopped seeing her for it, and then she ended up HAVING to do it at the new OB anyway. It's a very important test, your baby is more likely to be stillborn with untreated diabetes, among many, many other things. I agree with the other ladies, if you fail the first one, just ask to be treated like a diabetic then that way you don't have to go through the 3 hour. But a LOT of women fail the 1st and not the 2nd.
You can refuse anything you like but then your doctor has the right to stop seeing you.

your doc may just want you to do the 3 hr because pf the ampunt of women who fail the one hr but pass the 3 hr.. its really not that bad. yougo in after fasting and they take ur blood samples then drink basically a diluted semi carbinated fruit syrupy thing im a little 8 oz bottle and can leave and do other stuff as long as ur back each hr to take the blood draw... honestly I wish my doc had just had me do the 3 hr to begin with instead of the 1 hr so I wouldnt have worried myself for the week.after they called to tell me I failed the first one. id suggest doing it more for your baby's health than your own.

I should add she had to do it at her 2nd OB because she was lucky to find one that late in the game anyway, and they would refuse seeing her if she didn't take the test as well, it's too much of a liability on them.

Why would you want to put yourself and your baby at risk by not drinking a simple little drink......that just doesn't make since to me....your doctor wouldn't have you do it if it wasn't important.
